question: Propanone and Propanal are:
explanation: Propanone (<katex>$CH_3COCH_3$</katex>) contains a ketone group, while propanal (<katex>$CH_3CH_2CHO$</katex>) contains an aldehyde group. Since they have the same molecular formula (<katex>$C_3H_6O$</katex>) but different functional groups, they are functional isomers.
